intro: Lagascea helianthifolia, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often twining. Lagascea helianthifolia is adapted to harsh, dry environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
